On 13 January 2013, the band announced that the album would be released in June under the title13 (Black Sabbath album)13.Brad WilkofRage Against the Machinewas chosen as the drummer, andRick Rubinwas chosen as the producer.cite webhttp://www.rollingstone.com/music/news/black-sabbath-announce-new-album-13-due-out-in-june-20130113Black Sabbath Announce New Album, '13,' Due Out in JuneRolling Stone13 January 20139 February 2013Audio mixing (recorded music)Mixingof the album commenced in February.cite webhttp://www.blabbermouth.net/news.aspx?modeBlack Sabbath To Begin Mixing New Album in FebruaryBlabbermouth.net31 January 20139 February 2013On 12 April 2013, the band released the album's track listing. The standard version of the album features eight new tracks, and the deluxe version features three bonus tracks.cite webhttp://ultimateclassicrock.com/black-sabbath-bonus-songs-13-deluxe-edition/Black Sabbath Adds Bonus Songs To '13' Deluxe EditionDaveLiftonUltimate Classic Rock19 April 201319 April 2013

The band's first single from13, "God Is Dead?", was released on 19 April 2013.cite webhttp://www.billboard.com/articles/review/1558856/black-sabbath-god-is-dead-single-reviewBlack Sabbath, 'God Is Dead?': Single ReviewGaryGraffBillboard19 April 201319 April 2013On 20 April 2013, Black Sabbath commenced their first Australia/New Zealand tour in 40 years, to be followed by a major North American Tour in Summer 2013.cite webhttp://www.rollingstone.com/music/news/black-sabbath-book-four-north-american-dates-20130416Black Sabbath Book Four North American DatesEric D.DandtonRolling Stone16 April 201319 April 2013Black Sabbath 2013 U.S. Tour ''Billboard'' MagazineThe second single of the album, "End of the Beginning", debuted on 15 May in aCSI: Crime Scene Investigationepisode, where all three members appeared.cite webhttp://www.rollingstone.com/music/news/black-sabbath-to-premiere-new-single-on-csi-season-finale-20130410Black Sabbath to Premiere New Single on 'CSI' Season FinaleRolling StoneAndyGreene10 April 201319 April 2013In June 2013,13topped both theUK Albums Chartand the USBillboard 200''Billboard'' 200.cite webKeithCaulfieldhttp://www.billboard.com/articles/news/1567354/black-sabbath-earns-first-no-1-album-on-billboard-200-chartBlack Sabbath Earns First No. 1 Album on Billboard 200 Chart[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]][[Nielsen Company]]19 June 201323 June 2013cite webDanielLanehttp://www.officialcharts.com/chart-news/black-sabbath-make-chart-history-with-first-number-1-album-in-nearly-43-years-2287/Black Sabbath make chart history with first Number 1 album in nearly 43 years[[Official Charts Company]]16 June 201323 June 2013"God Is Dead?" earned Black Sabbath their firstGrammy Awardin 14 years forGrammy Award for Best Metal PerformanceBest Metal Performancein 2014.cite newshttp://loudwire.com/black-sabbath-god-is-dead-wins-2014-grammy-best-metal-performance/Black Sabbath's 'God Is Dead?' Wins 2014 Grammy for Best Metal PerformanceChildersChad26 January 2014[[Loudwire]]26 January 2014

In July 2013, Black Sabbath embarked on a North American Tour (for the first time since July 2001), followed by a Latin American tour in October 2013. In November 2013, the band started their European tour which lasted until December 2013.Black Sabbath Tourdates. Retrieved at 14 November 2013.In March and April 2014, they made 12 stops in North America (mostly in Canada) as the second leg of their North American Tour before embarking in June 2014 on the second leg of their European tour, which ended with a concert at London's Hyde Park.cite webhttp://loudwire.com/black-sabbath-announce-2014-north-american-tour-dates/Black Sabbath Announce 2014 North American Tour DatesLoudwire.com2013-11-142014-04-25
article.heading: Final tour (2014present)
article.paragraph: On 29 September 2014, vocalistOzzy OsbournetoldMetal Hammerthat Black Sabbath would begin work on their twentieth studio album in early 2015 with producerRick Rubin, followed by a final tour in 2016.cite webhttp://www.blabbermouth.net/news/black-sabbath-to-begin-work-on-new-studio-album-next-year/Black Sabbath To Begin Work On New Studio Album Next YearBlabbermouth.net2014-09-292014-09-29cite webhttp://www.blabbermouth.net/news/black-sabbath-to-begin-work-on-new-studio-album-next-year/Black Sabbath To Embark On Final Tour In 2016, Says Ozzy OsbourneBlabbermouth.net28 April 201528 April 2015In an April 2015 interview, however, Osbourne said that these plans "could change", and added, "We all live in different countries and some of them want to work and some of them don't want to, I believe. But we are going to do another tour together."

On 3 September 2015, it was announced that Black Sabbath will embark on their final tour, titledThe End TourThe Endfrom January to July 2016.http://www.blacksabbath.com/events-details.html?dc_id=361cite webhttp://www.blabbermouth.net/news/black-sabbath-announces-the-end-world-tour/Black Sabbath Announces 'The End' World TourBlabbermouth.net3 September 20153 September 2015Numerous dates and locations across the US, Canada, Europe, Australia and New Zealand have been announced thus far.https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FYCvRV5ME3whttp://www.blacksabbath.com/events-details.html?dc_id=361

On 26 October 2015, it was announced the band consisting of Osbourne, Iommi and Butler will be returning to the Download Festival 2016 on Saturday 11 June.cite webhttp://www.ozzy.com/us/news/black-sabbath-announced-saturday-headliner-download-2016black sabbath announced saturday headliner download 201620 October 2015ozzy.comozzy.com28 October 2015cite webhttp://downloadfestival.co.uk/lineup-posterlineup poster20 October 2015downloadfestival.co.ukdownloadfestival.co.uk28 October 2015Despite earlier reports that they would enter the studio before their farewell tour, Osbourne stated that there will not be another Black Sabbath studio album.cite webhttp://www.blabbermouth.net/news/ozzy-osbourne-why-there-wont-be-another-black-sabbath-studio-album/Ozzy Osbourne: Why There Won't Be Another Black Sabbath Studio AlbumBlabbermouth.net30 October 201530 October 2015
article.heading: Musical style
article.paragraph: Black Sabbath are aheavy metal musicheavy metalband, whose music has also been described aspsychedelic rock,Turn on Your Mind: Four Decades of Great Psychedelic Rock, Jim DeRogatis, page 396blues rock,hard rock,progressive rock,cite webhttp://www.blacksabbath.com/history.htmlThe Official Black Sabbath Website :: The History of Black SabbathBlacksabbath.com2015-08-25proto-progressive metal,cite webSteve Hueyhttp://www.allmusic.com/album/sabotage-mw0000652467Sabotage - Black Sabbath | Songs, Reviews, Credits, Awards[[AllMusic]]2015-08-25andacid rock.cite webhttp://www.allmusic.com/style/stoner-metal-ma0000011961Stoner Metal | Significant Albums, Artists and Songs[[AllMusic]]2015-08-25The band have also been cited as a key influence on genres includingstoner rock,doom metal,cite webhttp://www.allmusic.com/style/doom-metal-ma0000004496Doom Metal | Significant Albums, Artists and Songs[[AllMusic]]2015-08-25andsludge metal.cite webhttps://applause.uterwincenter.com/black-sabbath-iron-men/Black Sabbath at the Frank Erwin Center in Austin, Texas July 27, 2013Applause.uterwincenter.com2013-06-172015-08-25

Early on Black Sabbath were influenced byCream (band)Cream,the Beatles,Fleetwood Mac,The Jimi Hendrix ExperienceJimi Hendrix,John Mayall & the Bluesbreakers,Led ZeppelinandJethro Tull (band)Jethro Tull.cite webhttp://www.iommi.com/archive/the_holy_sabbath.htmThe Holy Sabbath: Ozzy and Tony talk drugs, the devil and how they invented heavy metalIommi.comRolling Stone9 August 2014cite webhttp://www.blabbermouth.net/news/black-sabbath-s-geezer-butler-talks-lyrical-inspiration-rock-band-iron-man-movies/Black Sabbath's Geezer Butler talks lyrical inspiration, 'Rock Band', 'Iron Man' MoviesBlabbermouth.net9 October 2015

Although Black Sabbath have gone through many line-ups and stylistic changes, their core sound focuses on ominous lyrics and doomy music,often making use of the musicaltritone, also called the "devil's interval".sfnLewis200172While their Ozzy-era albums such asSabbath Bloody Sabbathhad slight compositional similarities to theprogressive rockgenre that was growing in popularity at the time,standing in stark contrast to popular music of the early 1970s Black Sabbath's dark sound was dismissed by rock critics of the era.Much like many of their earlyTraditional heavy metalheavy metalcontemporaries, the band received virtually no airplay on rock radio.sfnBarnet200187–88

As the band's primary songwriter, Tony Iommi wrote the majority of Black Sabbath's music, while Osbourne would write vocal melodies, and bassist Geezer Butler would write lyrics. The process was sometimes frustrating for Iommi, who often felt pressured to come up with new material. "If I didn't come up with anything, nobody would do anything."sfnRosen199676On Iommi's influence, Osbourne later said:

paragraph.template: quote<arg name="Black Sabbath never used to write a structured song. There'd be a long intro that would go into a jazz piece, then go all folky ... and it worked. Tony Iommi—and I have said this a zillion times—should be up there with the greats. He can pick up a guitar, play a riff, and you say, 'He's gotta be out now, he can't top that.' Then you come back, and I bet you a billion dollars, he'd come up with a riff that'd knock your fucking socks off.{{cite web|last">Sprague |first

article.paragraph: Beginning with their third album,Master of Reality, Black Sabbath began to featureguitar tuningstuned-downguitars.In 1965, before forming Black Sabbath, guitarist Tony Iommi suffered an accident while working in asheet metalfactory, losing the tips of two fingers on his right hand. Iommi almost gave up music, but was urged by the factory manager to listen toDjango Reinhardt, ajazzguitarist who lost the use of two fingers.sfnRosen1996135Inspired by Reinhardt, Iommi created two thimbles made of plastic and leather to cap off his missing fingertips. The guitarist began using lighter strings, and detuning his guitar, to better grip the strings with hisprosthesis.Early in the band's history Iommi experimented with differentdropped tunings, including Cmusicsharptuning, or 3 semitones down, before settling on Emusicflat/Dmusicsharptuning, or a half-step down from standard tuning.cite webhttp://iommi.com/images/spread.jpgTony Iommi interview1 March 2009yeshttps://web.archive.org/20090305020833/http://iommi.com/images/spread.jpg5 March 2009
article.heading: Legacy
article.paragraph: Black Sabbath has sold over 70 million records worldwide,cite webhttp://www.black-sabbath.com/Black Sabbath Is Backblack-sabbath.com11 November 201110 February 2013including aRIAA-certified 15 million in the US.cite webhttp://riaa.com/goldandplatinumdata.php?content_selectorRIAA Searchable Database8 February 2013They are one of the most influential heavy metal bands of all time. The band helped to create the genre with ground-breaking releases such asParanoid (album)Paranoid, an album thatRolling Stonemagazine said "changed music forever",cite webDiehlMatthttp://www.rollingstone.com/artists/blacksabbath/articles/story/5939997/the_holy_sabbathThe Holy SabbathRolling Stone25 April 2008//web.archive.org/web/20080617164618/http://www.rollingstone.com/artists/blacksabbath/articles/story/5939997/the_holy_sabbath17 June 2008yesand called the band "the Beatlesof heavy metal".cite webNavarroDavehttp://www.rollingstone.com/music/lists/100-greatest-artists-of-all-time-19691231/black-sabbath-20110420100 Greatest Artists of All Time: 85) Black SabbathRolling Stone8 February 2013Time MagazinecalledParanoid"the birthplace of heavy metal", placing it in their Top 100 Albums of All Time.cite newshttp://entertainment.time.com/2006/11/02/the-all-time-100-albums/All Time 100[[Time (magazine)|Time]]25 April 20082 November 2006Rolling Stonemagazine ranked Black Sabbath number 85 in their list of the "100 Greatest Artists of All Time.MTV placed Black Sabbath at number one on their Top Ten Heavy Metal Bands andVH1placed them at number two on their list of the 100 Greatest Artists of Hard Rock.cite webhttp://www.mtv.com/bands/m/metal/greatest_metal_bands/071406/index2.jhtmlGreatest Metal Artists of All TimeMTV29 March 2008cite webhttp://www.rockonthenet.com/archive/2000/vh1hardrock.htmRock the Net-VH1: 100 Greatest Hard Rock Artists9 April 2009VH1 ranked Black Sabbath's "Iron Man" the number one song on their 40 Greatest Metal Songs countdown.cite webhttp://www.blabbermouth.net/news.aspx?modeBLACK SABBATH's 'Iron Man' Tops VH1 List As the Greatest Metal Song of All TimeBlabbermouth.net25 April 2008Allmusic's William Ruhlmann said:

paragraph.template: quote<arg name="Black Sabbath has been so influential in the development of heavy metal rock music as to be a defining force in the style. The group took the blues-rock sound of late '60s acts like [[Cream (band)|Cream]], [[Blue Cheer]], and [[Vanilla Fudge]] to its logical conclusion, slowing the tempo, accentuating the bass, and emphasising screaming guitar solos and howled vocals full of lyrics expressing mental anguish and macabre fantasies. If their predecessors clearly came out of an electrified blues tradition, Black Sabbath took that tradition in a new direction, and in so doing helped give birth to a musical style that continued to attract millions of fans decades later.<ref name">"AMG Biography"/>

article.paragraph: According toRolling Stone'sHolly George-Warren, "Black Sabbath was the heavy metal king of the 70s."cite bookGeorge-WarrenHolly2001The Rolling Stone Encyclopedia of Rock and Roll2005Fireside978-0-7432-9201-681–82Although initially "despised by rock critics and ignored by radio programmers", the group sold more than 8 million albums by the end of that decade.

Metallica'sLars Ulrich, who, along with bandmateJames Hetfieldinducted Black Sabbath into theRock and Roll Hall of Famein 2006, said "Black Sabbath is and always will be synonymous with heavy metal",cite webhttp://www.blabbermouth.net/news.aspx?modeMETALLICA Induct BLACK SABBATH into ROCK AND ROLL HALL OF FAME: Photos AvailableBlabbermouth.net25 April 2008while Hetfield said "Sabbath got me started on all that evil-sounding shit, and it's stuck with me. Tony Iommi is the king of the heavy riff."cite webhttp://www.blabbermouth.net/news.aspx?modeMetal/Hard Rock Musicians Pay Tribute To BLACK SABBATH's 'Paranoid'Blabbermouth.net25 April 2008Ex-Guns N' RosesguitaristSlash (musician)Slashsaid of theParanoidalbum: "There's just something about that whole record that, when you're a kid and you're turned onto it, it's like a whole different world. It just opens up your mind to another dimension ...Paranoidis the whole Sabbath experience; very indicative of what Sabbath meant at the time. Tony's playing style doesn't matter whether it's offParanoidor if it's offHeaven and Hellit's very distinctive."Anthrax (American band)AnthraxguitaristScott Iansaid "I always get the question in every interview I do, 'What are your top five metal albums?' I make it easy for myself and always say the first five Sabbath albums."

Lamb of God (band)Lamb of God'sChris Adler (drummer)Chris Adlersaid: "If anybody who plays heavy metal says that they weren't influenced by Black Sabbath's music, then I think that they're lying to you. I think all heavy metal music was, in some way, influenced by what Black Sabbath did."cite webMorganAnthonyhttp://www.blabbermouth.net/news.aspx?modeLAMB OF GOD To Switch Record Labels For Non-U.S. TerritoriesBlabbermouth.net25 April 2008Judas Priest vocalistRob Halfordcommented: "They were and still are a groundbreaking band..you can put on the first Black Sabbath album and it still sounds as fresh today as it did 30-odd years ago. And that's because great music has a timeless ability: To me, Sabbath are in the same league as the Beatles or Mozart. They're on the leading edge of something extraordinary."cite webhttp://www.mtv.com/bands/m/metal/greatest_metal_bands/071406/index2.jhtmlThe Greatest Metal Bands of All TimeMTV10 February 2013On Black Sabbath's standing,Rage Against the MachineguitaristTom Morellostates: "The heaviest, scariest, coolest riffs and the apocalyptic Ozzy wail are without peer. You can hear the despair and menace of the working-class Birmingham streets they came from in every kick-ass, evil groove. Their arrival ground hippy, flower-power psychedelia to a pulp and set the standard for all heavy bands to come."Phil AnselmoofPanteraandDown (band)Downstated that "Only a fool would leave out what Black Sabbath brought to the heavy metal genre".cite webhttp://www.metalhammer.co.uk/news/phil-anselmo-only-a-fool-would-leave-out-black-sabbath/Phil Anselmo: Only A Fool Would Leave Out Black Sabbathmetalhammer.co.uk13 June 2013

Tony Iommi has been credited as the pioneer of lighter gauge guitar strings. The tips of his fingers were severed in a steel factory,cite webGraffGaryhttp://www.billboard.com/articles/news/465276/black-sabbath-reunion-coming-were-talking-says-tony-iommiBlack Sabbath Reunion Coming? 'We're Talking,' Says Tony IommiBillboard7 November 201110 February 2013and while using thimbles (artificial finger tips) he found that standard guitar strings were too difficult to bend and play. He found that there was only one size of strings available, so after years with Sabbath he had strings custom made.Rosen, Steven. "Black Sabbath Uncensored on the Record". p.1928. Coda Books Ltd. Retrieved 19 June 2012

Culturally, Black Sabbath have exerted a huge influence in both television and literature and have in many cases become synonymous with heavy metal. In the filmAlmost Famous,Lester Bangsgives the protagonist an assignment to cover the band (plot point one) with the immortal line: 'Give me 500 words on Black Sabbath'. Contemporary music and arts publicationTrebuchet Magazinehas put this to practice by asking all new writers to write a short piece (500 words) on Black Sabbath as a means of proving their creativity and voice on a well documented subject.cite webhttp://www.trebuchet-magazine.com/honest-and-unmerciful-writers-on-black-sabbath/Honest and Unmerciful – Writers on Black SabbathTrebuchet Magazine9 August 201210 February 2013
